Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix v 3.2.0 - Sample Parser Program to Read WARC file contents?

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Thanks Noah,

This is very helpful. I am able to parse the data now. Could =
you answer the below questions as well?

Questions:

1. How can I get the H=
TTP Status code in v 3.2?
In v 3.1 I used to do the below operations
>>>
>>=
>
>>>record holds an object of type ArcRecord;
>>>
>>>
>>>int httpStatusCod=
e =3D record.getStatusCode();
>>>
>>>
>>>It returns me the HTTP Status code=
 i.e. either 201, 301, etc..

2. How can I skip the header portion from WAR=
C Record? Basically I just want to store only the 3rd part of the WARC reco=
rd. 

E.g WARC record:

---- Part 1----
>WARC/1.0
>WARC-Type: response
>WAR=
C-Target-URI: 
>WARC-Date: 2014-06-16T12:41:22Z
>WARC-Payload-Digest:
>WARC=
-IP-Address: 
>WARC-Record-ID: 
>Content-Type: application/http; msgtype=3D=
response
>Content-Length: 
>
>
>----- Part 2 -----
>HTTP/1.0 200 OK
>X-Powe=
red-By: 
>Cache-Control: 
>Cache-Control: 
>Content-Type: text/html; charse=
t=3DUTF-8
>Content-Language: en-US
>Date: 
>Connection: 
>Set-Cookie: 
>Set=
-Cookie: 
>Set-Cookie: 
>
>
>----Part 3 -----
><!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3=
C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-=
transitional.dtd">
><html xmlns=3D"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
><head>
>=
rest of the HTML from a website

In v 3.1, I used to do record.skipHttpHead=
er(); But I cannot execute this code anymore in v 3.2.

My current code is =
below. This gets me the record from Part 2 onwards.
ByteArrayOutputStream b=
aos=3D newByteArrayOutputStream();
record.dump(baos);
byte[] content=3D bao=
s.toByteArray();
String parsedData=3D newString(content, "UTF-8");



Appre=
ciate your help.

-Ravi

 


On Wednesday, June 18, 2014 7:30 AM, "Noah Lev=
itt nlevitt@... [archive-crawler]" <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com=
> wrote:
  


=C2=A0 
In 3.2.0 those classes are in ia-web-commons.jar.

No=
ah



On Tue, Jun 17, 2014 at 5:19 AM, Arin Patel Itha iarinpatel@...=
 [archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:


>
>
>=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0
>All,
>
>
>I had an experience of using Heritrix v 3.1.0=
. I used to process Arc files and load the HTML records into a Database. 
>=

>
>Nowadays, I am working on v 3.2.0 and Heritrix is generating warc files=
. 
>
>
>However, I could not figure out a way to read the contents of WARC =
file and store its records into a Database based on what I know how it work=
s with v 3.1.0. 
>
>
>I am unable to find the below classes in heritrix-com=
mons-3.2.0.jar
>
>
>	1. WARCReaderFactory
>	2. WARCReader
>	3. WARCHeader 
=
>	4. etc..
>
>
>Note: The package structure org.archive.io.* of v 3.1.0 is =
totally different to v 3.2.0 
>
>
>So can somebody please advise, how I can=
 build a parser with the latest Heritrix release and send me a sample progr=
am?
>
>
>Thanks,
>Ravi Itha
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> 
>
>
